trans-unit.source: Specifies the feature requirements that bindings must provide to the service or client implementation.

Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> to instruct [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] to confirm that the binding provides the features required by the service or client implementation.

If a <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> attribute is detected when a service description is loaded from an application configuration file or built programmatically in code, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] validates the configured binding and supports all the features that the attribute specifies.
For example, your service may require the bindings to support queuing.
Using <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> allows [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm that the following requirements are met:
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.QueuedDeliveryRequirements%2A> property specifies the queuing requirements that a binding must meet.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.RequireOrderedDelivery%2A> property indicates whether the binding must support ordered messaging.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.TargetContract%2A> property indicates to which type the requirements apply.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> attribute is applied to a class, which can implement any number of service contract interfaces.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute> can be applied to all the contracts the class implements or to only one of them.
The attribute can be applied to a class more than once.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute"></xref> class.
The defaults are:
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.QueuedDeliveryRequirements%2A> property is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode.Allowed>.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.RequireOrderedDelivery%2A> property is set to `false`.
Specifies whether the binding for a service must support queued contracts.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode.Required> instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm that the binding supports queued delivery.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode.NotAllowed> value instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to confirm that the binding does not support queued delivery.
One of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode"></xref> values; the default is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode.Allowed"></xref>.
The value is not one of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.QueuedDeliveryRequirementsMode"></xref> values.
Specifies whether the binding must support ordered messages.
Setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.RequireOrderedDelivery%2A> property to `false` instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to perform no validation.
`true` instructs [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] to confirm that the binding must support the ordering of messages; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the type to which it applies.
A service class can implement any number of service contract interfaces.

Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.TargetContract%2A> property to validate that endpoints with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.TargetContract%2A> have bindings that support the requirements.
This attribute can be used any number of times on the same class.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to which the attribute applies.

Implements the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.System#ServiceModel#Description#IContractBehavior#AddBindingParameters(System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription,System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint,System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection)"></xref> method to attach binding parameters correctly.
The contract description.
The service endpoint for the contract.
The binding parameters.

Implementation of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.System#ServiceModel#Description#IContractBehavior#ApplyClientBehavior(System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription,System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint,System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime)"></xref> method for client support.
The contract description to which the behavior is attached.
The endpoint for the contract.
The client runtime on which the behavior operates.

Implementation of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior.ApplyDispatchBehavior(System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription,System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint,System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.DispatchRuntime)"></xref> method that enables service support.
The contract description to which the behavior is attached.
The endpoint for the contract.
The dispatch runtime that supports the endpoint.

Implements the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.DeliveryRequirementsAttribute.System#ServiceModel#Description#IContractBehavior#Validate(System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription,System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint)"></xref> method to enable validation support.
The contract description.
The endpoint to be validated.
